page.title: 06MID SUSSEX EMPLOYMENT (2)
page.content: When the wood is finished it is dipped in cedar preserve called Cuprinol: they use 500 gallon tanks. This helps to preserve it in winter.They use a variety of machines such as a double ender, a spindle, a cross cut machine and a ply saw.In the sawmill there is a glass work shop where windows are fitted. They use Russian glass:a British glass is too expensive. The glass is cut with a tiny wheel which makes an indentation in the glass, enough for it to be snapped down the middle.They send the glass out to the customer,wrapped in hay.The mill also supplies roofing felt.They try not to do retail sale and the sawdust which is not needed is sold to local farmers.
